body.p: At this point, Bloggie can display posts from the database, but can't yet allow the blog readers to submit their own comments.

To achieve this, we're going to use various Agavi techniques:
Slots are used to embed an Action's output in a template that belongs to another Action. We're going to use them to display the comments inside a post page, and to display the form used to submit these comments.
Validation is used to ensure that user-submitted data obeys specified laws. Using validation, we'll ensure that the comments our readers submit are safe.
Action methods specify how an Action responds to a certain HTTP verb. We'll see how to implement HTTP POST handling.
